section.heading: Exemptions for beer and wine manufacturers and machinery used to manufacture beer and wine. Refund of taxes paid under chapter

content.p: For purposes of subparagraph (A) of subdivision
of section12-412, subdivision
of section12-412and section12-412i, on and after July 1, 2023, a sale to a purchaser that manufactures or will manufacture
beer under a manufacturer permit for beer issued pursuant to section30-16,
wine and brandies under a manufacturer permit for a farm winery issued pursuant to section30-16, or

wine, cider and mead under a manufacturer permit for wine, cider and mead issued pursuant to section30-16, which sale would otherwise qualify for the sales and use tax exemption pursuant to subparagraph (A) of subdivision
of subdivision
of section12-412, subdivision

of section12-412or section12-412i, except for the fact that such beer, wine, brandy, cider or mead is manufactured or will be manufactured at a facility that also makes substantial retail sales, shall qualify for such exemption in the same manner as if such sale was to an industrial plant.
For purposes of subdivision

of section12-412, on and after July 1, 2023, a sale of machinery to a purchaser, which sale would otherwise qualify for the sales and use tax exemption pursuant to said subdivision except for the fact that such machinery will be used to manufacture beer, wine, brandy, cider or mead, at a facility that also makes substantial retail sales, shall qualify for such exemption in the same manner as if such sale was to an industrial plant.
Notwithstanding the provisions of subdivisions
and
of section12-425, any taxpayer who holds a manufacturer permit set forth in subsection

of this section and is in good standing with the Department of Consumer Protection on July 1, 2023, shall be eligible for a refund of the amount of taxes paid by such holder under this chapter between July 1, 2018, and June 30, 2023, inclusive, on the purchases that would have been exempt from such taxes if the exemptions provided under subsections
and
of this section had been in effect.

Any taxpayer who believes such taxpayer is owed a refund under this subsection shall, not later than July 1, 2026, file a claim with the Department of Revenue Services and shall provide documentation with such claim that substantiates the amount of the tax imposed under this chapter for which the taxpayer is seeking a refund. The provisions of subdivisions
and

of section12-425shall apply to a claim filed pursuant to this subsection. Any amount refunded to a taxpayer pursuant to this subsection shall be made without interest. (Return to ChapterTable of Contents)(Return toList of Chapters)(Return toList of Titles)
